title: TypeError: init_weights() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given
body:
`Traceback (most recent call last):`
`  File "run_bert.py", line 223, in <module>`
    `    main()`
`  File "run_bert.py", line 216, in main`
    `    run_train(args)`
`  File "run_bert.py", line 70, in run_train`
`    model = BertForMultiLable.from_pretrained(config['bert_model_dir'], num_labels=len(label_list))`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pytorch_transformers/modeling_utils.py", line 536, in from_pretrained`
`    model = cls(config, *model_args, **model_kwargs)`
`  File "/content/section-multi-class-classification/pybert/model/nn/bert_for_multi_label.py", line 11, in __init__`
`    self.apply(self.init_weights)`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 247, in apply`
    `module.apply(fn)`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 247, in apply`
    `module.apply(fn)`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 247, in apply`
    `module.apply(fn)`
`  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 248, in apply`
    `fn(self)`
`TypeError: init_weights() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given`

`python run_bert.py --do_train --save_best --do_lower_case

Can anyone please solve this issue? The run_bert and bert_for_multi_label file is as it in the repo so can anyone tell what's wrong going on?
